intro: Marlierea eugenioides var. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf marlierea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
